thisphotobylanehartwell.com: Lane Hartwell and the Great Creative Rights Conundrum

173 words written on Fri, Dec 21 2007

It all started a while back when Lane Hartwell got frustrated. Friends spoke up on her behalf.

At some point she called a lawyer and enacted the DMCA on the offending party‚Äôs asses. See Misunderstanding Copyright Law And Ruining Everyone‚Äôs Fun and/or My statement regarding the Richter Scales ‚ÄúHere comes another bubble‚Äù video dispute.

So there was some mainstream media coverage, and of course the bloggers sang along like a gospel choir. Some offered ‚Äúeasy‚Äù solutions.

Finally, she just sent an invoice. And the video was remade without her photograph included.

Early on in all this, I bought thisphotobylanehartwell.com. I‚Äôve been tracking and writing about the situation in a friends-only post, but in the end, less is more.

So go over to lanehartwell.com, er, I mean thisphotobylanehartwell.com. It is customizable so that whenever you need to provide attribution to someone you can do it in really big text.
